intro: Bupleurum ghahremanii, commonly known as Persian boldo, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Iran. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
